body.p: I beg to say in reply to your obliging letter, that I cannot accede to the request with which the Members of the Parochial Committee2The request not identified.have honoured me, as aI think it very probable I may be induced to take my family to Switzerland this Summer,CD left with his family for Switzerland, 31 May, staying there until he moved to Paris, 16 November. and may remain there (for the more quiet execution of a literary project)CD began writing Dombey and Son, “a long book...which I could write better in retirement” (To Coutts, 22 Apr 46), in Lausanne in June. He also began there in September his Christmas Book, The Battle of Life: “I never had to begin two stories together, before: and it is desperate work” (To Mitton, 25 Sep 46). some twelve months.aCD, with short visits to London, stayed abroad until his return from Paris at the end of February 1847.
